result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Preliminary Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:58 AM Defendant William C. Buchanan in court by audio with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense stipulates to identification of Defendant. Court takes judicial notice of 21CF1117. Officer Alex Limberg sworn in and testified by video. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Bradley Lochowicz

03:07 PM Defendant William C. Buchanan in court, in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Francis P Raff by video.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth confirmed. Signature Bond set of $1000 with conditions:  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No driving. Must remain in residence from 6pm-6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Preliminary hearing requested. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Must be in residence from 6 pm to 6 am unless at work or going directly to and from work.  Not to possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No drug paraphernalia.  Not to drive any motor vehicle.
